meanings.definition: To make something more complex or difficult than necessary.
meanings.sent1: Let's not overcomplicate the recipe by adding too many ingredients.
meanings.sent2: She tends to overcomplicate simple tasks by overthinking them.
meanings.sent3: John always manages to overcomplicate things, even when they are straightforward.
meanings.sent4: Trying to overcomplicate the solution will only lead to more confusion.
meanings.sent5: Don't overcomplicate the instructions, keep them clear and concise.

meanings.definition: To add unnecessary details or complications to a situation.
meanings.sent1: Please don't overcomplicate the presentation with too many slides.
meanings.sent2: He has a tendency to overcomplicate his stories with unnecessary plot twists.
meanings.sent3: The team decided to overcomplicate the project by introducing new requirements at the last minute.
meanings.sent4: She always finds a way to overcomplicate even the simplest of tasks.
meanings.sent5: Adding too many rules will only overcomplicate the game for the players.
